Posts.Content: DIO, Thank you for giving me your bio. You sound very positive about all of this and that is a great thing. I'm naturally an upbeat person, but this has shaken me a bit. I've read on the net and heard that radiation can be difficult but that did not seem to be your case. Thanks again. L
Posts.Signature: 41 Ductal Carcinoma In-situ Non-invasive (currently known) Grade 2
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: HI. New to the boards.... I was diagnosed on Wednesday with DCIS. I am 41, pre-menopasol and never would have predicted this. My lumpecomy is scheduled for July 28th. What type of pain or discomfort should I expect? If all goes well, I go for radiation for 6-8 weeks thereafter. What should I expect from the radiation? Doc says I'll get a sunburn. Net says I will lose my appetite. Will I be tired? HOw tired? Thank you in advance.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Just wondering how you did with the news, surgery and after-surgery experience.
Posts.Signature: 41 Ductal Carcinoma In-situ Non-invasive (currently known) Grade 2
